title: المَصْدَر المُؤَوَّل
description: Learn about المَصْدَر المُؤَوَّل (interpreted masdar), where أَنْ + verb forms a masdar meaning, and distinguish between المصدر الصريح (explicit masdar) and المصدر المؤول (interpreted masdar).

notes.title: What is المَصْدَر المُؤَوَّل?
content: المَصْدَر المُؤَوَّل (the interpreted masdar) is a construction where a particle like أَنْ or أَنَّ combines with a verb or sentence to create a meaning equivalent to a masdar (verbal noun). It is 'interpreted' because it functions as a noun without having an explicit noun form.

The most common formula is أَنْ + فِعْل مُضَارِع, which equals the masdar of that verb. For example, أَنْ تَدْرُسَ = الدِّرَاسَةُ (studying). This interpreted masdar can occupy any grammatical position a noun would: subject, object, mubtada, khabar, etc.
keyPoints: Functions as a noun in the sentence
Can be subject, object, mubtada, or khabar

examples.english: I want to learn = I want learning
It pleases me that you succeed = Your success pleases me
That you fast is better for you (Quran 2:184)
I was amazed that you did that

notes.title: المَصْدَر الصَّرِيح vs المَصْدَر المُؤَوَّل
content: المَصْدَر الصَّرِيح (explicit masdar) is the actual verbal noun: كِتَابَة، قِرَاءَة، ذَهَاب. It is a single word that names the action. المَصْدَر المُؤَوَّل is a clause (أَنْ + verb) that equals this meaning.

Both can substitute for each other in most contexts. However, the مصدر مؤول allows you to include the subject or object within it (أَنْ يَكْتُبَ زَيْدٌ - that Zayd writes), while the صريح requires a separate إضافة construction (كِتَابَةُ زَيْدٍ - Zayd's writing).
keyPoints: المؤول can include subject/object more naturally

examples.english: I love reading (explicit) = I love to read (interpreted)
I heard your recitation = I heard you reciting
Patience is beautiful = That you are patient is beautiful
Your going is obligatory = That you go is obligatory

notes.title: Particles that Form المَصْدَر المُؤَوَّل
content: Several particles can form المصدر المؤول: (1) أَنْ المصدرية: أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَذْهَبَ (I want to go), (2) أَنَّ المشددة: عَلِمْتُ أَنَّكَ نَاجِحٌ (I knew that you succeeded), (3) أَنْ المخففة من الثقيلة: عَلِمْتُ أَنْ سَيَنْجَحَ (I knew he would succeed).
أَنْ المصدرية is the most common, followed by أَنَّ. When أَنَّ is used, the entire إِنَّ وأخواتها clause becomes the مصدر مؤول: أَنَّكَ مُجْتَهِدٌ = اجتهادُك (your diligence).
keyPoints: أَنْ المخففة + السين أو سوف عادةً

examples.english: I want to succeed -> I want success
I heard that you are sick -> Your sickness reached me

examples.arabic: أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللهُ
examples.english: I testify that there is no god but Allah
And their final call is that praise is for Allah (Quran 10:10)

notes.title: Grammatical Positions of المَصْدَر المُؤَوَّل
content: المصدر المؤول can occupy any grammatical position that a noun can: (1) مُبْتَدَأ: أَنْ تَصُومُوا خَيْرٌ (Fasting is better), (2) خَبَر: قَصْدِي أَنْ أَتَعَلَّمَ (My goal is to learn), (3) فَاعِل: يَسُرُّنِي أَنْ تَحْضُرَ (Your coming pleases me), (4) مَفْعُول بِهِ: أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَسْأَلَ (I want to ask).
It can also follow prepositions as مجرور: عَجِبْتُ مِنْ أَنْ تَفْعَلَ هَذَا (I was amazed at your doing this). The entire clause (أَنْ + الفعل) is parsed as a single unit in the position of a مصدر.
keyPoints: مفعول به/مجرور: أُحِبُّ أَنْ أَقْرَأَ / عَجِبْتُ مِنْ أَنْ...

examples.english: That you fast is better for you (mubtada)
My hope is that you pardon me (khabar)
He commanded me to pray (maf'ul bihi)

exercises.promptEn: That you are patient is better = _____ is better (explicit masdar)
I was informed that _____ (you are) sick (anna + pronoun)
The interpreted masdar is composed of _____ + verb
'I love reading' - القِرَاءَة is a/an _____ masdar

exercises.prompt: That you fast is better for you (Quranic)
It pleases me that you succeeded

exercises.answer: the interpreted masdar (أَنْ + verb = noun meaning)

exercises.prompt: The particle that combines with a verb to form an interpreted masdar
A construction where a particle + verb equals a masdar meaning
